front.title: Recommendations for the ISPs' provision of IPv6 transition services to the ICPs

abstract.t: The exhaustion of IPv4 addresses is coming, while due to many reasons, no significant IPv6 deployment has occured. The transition of users, networks and services from IPv4 to IPv6 is not so smoothly and expeditiously as expected. The solutions now available are not sufficient for all the scenarios, so the IPv6 deployment models are revisited, and some new methods used for transition have been developed to complement the existing ones. This document discusses the transition of services and the use of these new mechanisms from the ISP's point of view to provide approaches to the transition for ICPs.
